properties.areaDesc: Zapata; Inland Willacy; Starr; Northern Hidalgo; Brooks; Inland Kenedy; Jim Hogg; Inland Cameron; Southern Hidalgo
properties.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued January 10 at 9:46AM CST until January 11 at 4:00PM CST by NWS Brownsville TX
properties.description:
...Elevated Risk of Wildfire Spread across most of Deep South
Texas Saturday...

.A cold front will move through deep South Texas tonight and
surface high pressure will build into the area in the wake of the
front Saturday morning. Much drier air will move into the Rio
Grande Valley Saturday and strong northwest winds will develop
Saturday morning and continue to remain strong through early
Saturday afternoon. This will lead to an elevated risk of wildfire
spread across most of deep South Texas except across the coastal
sections of the lower Texas coast Saturday.

The National Weather Service in Brownsville has issued a Fire
Weather Watch, which is in effect from Saturday morning through
Saturday afternoon.

* AFFECTED AREA...Fire weather zones 248, 249, 250, 251, 252,
253, 254, 255, and 353.

* WIND...15 TO 25 mph at the 20 foot level.

* HUMIDITY...20 to 30 percent.

* HIGHEST THREAT...is located across portions of Starr, Hidalgo
and Jim Hogg counties as well as portions of Willacy County.

* IMPACTS...any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly.
Outdoor burning is not recommended.
properties.instruction:
A fire weather watch means that critical fire weather conditions
are forecast to occur. In general...these conditions include
sustained 20 foot winds of 25 MPH or greater...humidity ranging
from below 25 percent in Zapata County to below 45 percent along
the coast...each lasting for 2 hours or more...and cured fuels.
Humidity below 25 percent in most areas will trigger fire danger
at lower wind speeds. Detailed decision tables are found at
HTTP://WEATHER.GOV/RGV/?N=MAPCOLORS#FIRE. Listen for later
forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.

NWSheadline: FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON FOR WINDS AND RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 248, 249, 250, 251, 252, 253, 254, 255, AND 353
